newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: TENNIS-HINGIS GIVES SWISS 1-0 LEAD OVER SLOVAKIA.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-HINGIS GIVES SWISS 1-0 LEAD OVER SLOVAKIA.

text.p: Australian Open champion Martina Hingis put Switzerland 1-0 ahead in their Federation Cup world group two first round tie against Slovakia on Saturday.
Hingis, who was born in Kosice 16 years ago, beat Slovak
number two Katarina Studenikova 6-1 6-3 in the opening singles.
"It was a nice feeling to play here after 12 years," Hingis said after the match.
"I got a great welcome when I entered the court and it was also great to win," Hingis, who has yet to lose a match this year, added.
Hingis sped through the first set in just 28 minutes after breaking Studenikova in the first game and conceded only the fifth game.
In the second set Hingis lost her serve, broke back, but again lost serve to trail 3-2.
In the sixth game, Studenikova had three points on serve for a 4-2 lead, but Hingis kept her cool to level at 3-3 and went on to win the match.
"My serve is not my strongest point and I haven't played a match for the last two weeks," Hingis said.
"I knew I had to tighten up my game, managed it and got into it again," she added.
When Hingis entered the court she got a warm welcome from the home crowd which, however, turned patriotic when the match started.
"But I think my father was keeping is fingers crossed for me even though I was actually playing against his country," Hingis said.
